A: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means living together in _ (a) fights (b) peace (c) anger)
2. Who taught us to live peacefully with others? (a) Saul (b) Jesus (c) David)
3. If someone offends us, we should _ them (a) fight (b) forgive (c) ignore)
4. God wants us to live peacefully with others (a) True (b) False)
5. Esau and Jacob showed peaceful co-existence (a) True (b) False)
6. Abraham prevented a quarrel with his nephew, _ (a) Esau (b) Lot (c) Isaac)
7. It is good to show _ to others (a) anger (b) love (c) sadness)
8. Jesus wants us to show love and _ to people (a) hatred (b) hospitality (c) fear)
9. We should tell others the _ (a) lies (b) truth (c) stories)
10. Jonathan loved _ very much (a) Saul (b) David (c) Abraham)
11. Jonathan loved David as his own _ (a) friend (b) brother (c) soul)
12. Who was Jonathan's father? (a) David (b) Saul (c) Esau)
13. King Saul planned to _ David (a) help (b) kill (c) praise)
14. Jonathan _ David from King Saul (a) hurt (b) saved (c) ignored)
15. Jonathan and David made a _ (a) fight (b) covenant (c) house)
16. Pupils should show _ to one another (a) anger (b) love (c) fear)
17. We should give help to the _ (a) rich (b) needy (c) strong)
18. We should share our belongings with others (a) True (b) False)
19. We should _ one another when there is danger (a) hide from (b) protect (c) fight)
20. Living together without disagreement is called peaceful _ (a) fighting (b) co-existence (c) playing)
B: 1. _________ is to bring something into existence.
2. Jesus advised us to _________ the person if somebody offends us.
3. Jonathan loved David as his own _________.
5. We should give help to the _________.
C: 2. Name two people from the Bible who showed peaceful co-existence.
3. Why is it good to show love to others?
4. How did Jonathan show unselfish love to David?
5. Name two ways pupils can show love to one another.
answers_C: It means different people living together in peace without disagreement or fighting.
Esau and Jacob, Abraham and Lot.
Jesus wants us to show love and hospitality, tell the truth, and be open-minded.
Jonathan loved David as his own soul, told him of King Saul's plan to kill him, and hid him.
Share belongings with others and protect one another when there is danger.
